original: @1b # // de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / nor bu'i rigs rnams bshad nas /
analyzed: @1b # // de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / nor bu'i rigs rnams bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the Vajrasattva, Tathagata, Vajra, Lotus, and Jewel families, which are the antidotes to desire and so forth,

original: da ni 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi tshul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams nas brtsams te /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi tshul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams nas brtsams te /
translated: now, beginning with the realm of sentient beings to be trained by the method of worldly deities,

original: de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: then the king, the vajra-holder,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ming po gsum gyi rtogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ming po gsum gyi rtogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and so forth, he explains the realization of the three brothers.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa ste /
translated: The word then is immediate,

original: dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: immediately after the samadhi of the first union.

original: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the samadhi of the first union is explained in the great mandala of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin ces bya ba ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin ces bya ba ni go bar zad do //
translated: The king, the vajra-holder, is self-evident.

original: 'jig rten gsum po zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir sa'i 'jig rten dang ; bar snang gi 'jig rten dang / mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du ming po gsum gyi tshul gyis bzhugs shing de'i chos nyid yin pas na 'jig rten gsum mo //üîΩkhams gsum pa zhes bya ba @2a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir sa'i 'jig rten dang ; bar snang gi 'jig rten dang / mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du ming po gsum gyi tshul gyis bzhugs shing de'i chos nyid yin pas na 'jig rten gsum mo // khams gsum pa zhes bya ba @2a * //
translated: The three worlds means that for the sake of training sentient beings, he abides in the manner of the three brothers in the world of the earth, the world of the sky, and the world of the heavens.

original: ni sems can gyi don dang / chos nyid kyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ni sems can gyi don dang / chos nyid kyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The three realms means that for the sake of sentient beings and by the nature of reality, he abides in the manner of desire, form, and the formless.

original: bdag po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang bskur ba brnyes pas na khams gsum pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: bdag po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang bskur ba brnyes pas na khams gsum pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: The lord means that he is the lord of the three realms because he has received the consecration of the Dharma kingdom of the three realms.

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba dang dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo yin bas na thams cad do //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba dang dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo yin bas na thams cad do //
translated: All means that he is the nature of all things, both moving and unmoving.

original: lha chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten pa gsum po la tshar gcod pa dang / phan 'dogs par mdzad pas na gsum gyi ston pa'o //
analyzed: lha chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten pa gsum po la tshar gcod pa dang / phan 'dogs par mdzad pas na gsum gyi ston pa'o //
translated: The teacher of the three means that he is the teacher of the three worlds, such as the great gods, because he acts to destroy and benefit.

original: cho ga bzhin du sgom gyur cing //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du sgom gyur cing //
translated: And meditates on them in accordance with the rite.

original: zhes bya ba ni ming po gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba de sgom zhing mngon sum du mdzad pa'o//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming po gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba de sgom zhing mngon sum du mdzad pa'o//
translated: This means that he meditates on and actualizes the benefit of all sentient beings by means of the mandala of the three brothers.

original: sems can don phyir cho gas bzhugs //
analyzed: sems can don phyir cho gas bzhugs //
translated: He abides in the rite for the sake of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni ming po gsum gyi bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams la ming po gsum rtogs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir cho ga bzhin du bzhugs pa ni sems can gyi don de sgom par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming po gsum gyi bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams la ming po gsum rtogs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir cho ga bzhin du bzhugs pa ni sems can gyi don de sgom par mdzad pa'o //
translated: This means that he abides in the rite for the sake of sentient beings in order to generate the realization of the three brothers in the realms of sentient beings who possess the habitual tendencies of the three brothers.

original: ji ltar sgom par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgom par mdzad ce na /
translated: How does he meditate?

original: 'dod chags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúattachment, etc. ‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams ni rnam pa thams @2b cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bos gnas pas na rnam par gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams ni rnam pa thams @2b cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bos gnas pas na rnam par gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Attachment, aversion, and delusion, which exist in the mindstreams of all sentient beings, are said to ‚Äúabide‚Äù because they exist in the form of the concepts of subject and object in every way.

original: mi mnyam pa'i rten gyur na zhes bya ba ni dngos por 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i rten gyur na zhes bya ba ni dngos por 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: If it becomes the basis of the unequal, it is made manifest by the very adherence to the apprehension of substantiality.

original: dug nyid du 'gro zhes bya ba la rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dug dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i srog 'phrog par byed pas na dug go //
analyzed: dug nyid du 'gro zhes bya ba la rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dug dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i srog 'phrog par byed pas na dug go //
translated: It becomes poison means that it is like the poison of the moving and unmoving poisons, because it severs the life of the root of the wholesome of all sentient beings.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa na dug nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa na dug nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is poison.

original: nye bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni dug gi rang bzhin ma yin par yang 'di dag dug gi bya ba byed pa'i tha tshig go / bdud rtsi nyid du 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la bdud ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni dug gi rang bzhin ma yin par yang 'di dag dug gi bya ba byed pa'i tha tshig go / bdud rtsi nyid du 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba la bdud ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: It goes to poison means that even though it is not of the nature of poison, it is the equivalent of the activity of poison.

original: de 'di la med pas na 'chi ba med pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: de 'di la med pas na 'chi ba med pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'o //
translated: It becomes nectar means that it is nectar because it is free from death.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ni bdud rtsi nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ni bdud rtsi nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of that is nectar.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of a distinction.

original: 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúChange‚Äù means ‚Äúgoing,‚Äù that is, the sense of ‚Äúgoing‚Äù is the same.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩbdud rtsi nyid kyis bsten 'gyur na //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / bdud rtsi nyid kyis bsten 'gyur na //
translated: How does it change?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pas na bdud rtsi nyid du bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pas na bdud rtsi nyid du bsten pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is served by nectar itself‚Äù means that it is served by nectar itself, since it is manifested by the nature of realitylessness for the sake of nirvana.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rgyal bar byed ba dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i tshul du yongs su rtog cing dngos po la mngon par zhen pas bsten na ni ngan song gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rgyal bar byed ba dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i tshul du yongs su rtog cing dngos po la mngon par zhen pas bsten na ni ngan song gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa yin la /
translated: If it is served by the conception of all things as having a nature of their own, by the conception of the three poisons as victorious, and by the conception of the accomplishment of all goals, then it becomes the cause of the three unfortunate realms.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par bsgoms pas mngon sum du byas nas thar pa chen po bskyed par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par bsgoms pas mngon sum du byas nas thar pa chen po bskyed par gyur pa yin no //
translated: But if it is manifested by the meditation on its natural purity, then it becomes the cause of the production of great liberation.

original: 'dod chags tshangs pa 'byin pa'i mchog / ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags ni ting nge 'dzin gyis tshangs pa yin zhing 'jig rten thams cad kyi dam pa yin pas mchog yin la skye bas na 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags tshangs pa 'byin pa'i mchog / ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags ni ting nge 'dzin gyis tshangs pa yin zhing 'jig rten thams cad kyi dam pa yin pas mchog yin la skye bas na 'byin pa'o //
translated: Passion existing in the mental continuum of all sentient beings is Brahma by means of concentration, and is supreme because it is the best of all worlds. It is produced by birth.

original: de gdul bya rnams la phan gdags bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' tshangs pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de gdul bya rnams la phan gdags bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' tshangs pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One, Vajrasattva, is said to be Brahma in order to benefit those to be trained.

original: zhe sdang drag po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i zhe sdang ni ting nge 'dzin gyis na drag po yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang drag po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i zhe sdang ni ting nge 'dzin gyis na drag po yin no //
translated: Wrath is the fierce one. Wrath existing in the mental continuum of all sentient beings is fierce by means of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis bya ba ni sgom pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis bya ba ni sgom pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The action by means of concentration is by the power of meditation.

original: gti mug @3a * //
analyzed: gti mug @3a * //
translated: Delusion is Vishnu.

original: khyab 'jug ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i gti mug ni khyab 'jug gi tshul du bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab 'jug ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i gti mug ni khyab 'jug gi tshul du bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Delusion existing in the mental continuum of all sentient beings is produced in the manner of Vishnu.

original: brtan mdzad nas /
analyzed: brtan mdzad nas /
translated: Having made them firm,

original: 'jig rten gsum po byin gyis brlabs //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po byin gyis brlabs //
translated: He blessed the three worlds.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug tshangs pa la sogs pa'i tshul du bskyed nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug tshangs pa la sogs pa'i tshul du bskyed nas /
translated: Thus, having generated desire, hatred, and ignorance in the manner of Brahma, etc.,

original: de la mos pa'i sems can rnams mgu bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba ji srid bar du brtan par mdzad nas de'i rjes la rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs 'jig rten gsum po yang dag par gyin gyis brlabs shing skyed par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mos pa'i sems can rnams mgu bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba ji srid bar du brtan par mdzad nas de'i rjes la rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs 'jig rten gsum po yang dag par gyin gyis brlabs shing skyed par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: in order to please the sentient beings who are devoted to them, he made them firm for as long as cyclic existence lasts, and after that, by the method of making them victorious, making them honey, and making all aims successful, he blessed and generated desire, etc., as the three worlds.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He declares, ‚ÄúDesire, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rang bzhin 'jig rten gsum po ni rtag par gnas shing rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du gnas pa dang / srid pa gsum ste 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rang bzhin 'jig rten gsum po ni rtag par gnas shing rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du gnas pa dang / srid pa gsum ste 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: are the three types of phenomena.

original: chos rnam pa gsum gyi tshul gyis bsten cing rang bzhin dag pas mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gsum gyi tshul gyis bsten cing rang bzhin dag pas mngon du byas nas /
translated: Having relied on them in this way and actualized them through their pure nature,

original: mchog gsum ste rgyal bar bya ba dang / sbrang rtsir bya ba dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog gsum ste rgyal bar bya ba dang / sbrang rtsir bya ba dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: they become the three supreme ones: the one to be conquered, the one to be made into honey, and the one that accomplishes all goals.

original: chos min bsten pas ngan song gsum //
analyzed: chos min bsten pas ngan song gsum //
translated: The three existences are the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i rang bzhin 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dngos por 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pas bsten na dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i rang bzhin 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dngos por 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pas bsten na dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang /
translated: If one relies on the nature of the conqueror, the nature of honey, and the nature of accomplishing all goals, which are attachment, anger, and delusion, by fixating on the entity of grasping, one will go to the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.üîΩ

original: dud 'gro'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngan song gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngan song gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the three poisons, attachment, aversion, and delusion, which is the cause of victory, honey, and the accomplishment of all goals, when relied upon by one who is attached to the belief in real entities, becomes the three unfortunate states of existence, the characteristics of which are hell-beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: 'dod chags sbrang rtsir byed par bshad //
analyzed: 'dod chags sbrang rtsir byed par bshad //
translated: Attachment is said to be honey.

original: ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i tshangs pa la ni sbrang rtsir byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i tshangs pa la ni sbrang rtsir byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Brahma, who assumes the form of a desire realm god, is called honey.

original: zhe sdang rgyal bar byed ces grags //
analyzed: zhe sdang rgyal bar byed ces grags //
translated: Aversion is known as the cause of victory.

original: zhes bya ba'i stobs bzangs kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'i drag po ni rgyal bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i stobs bzangs kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'i drag po ni rgyal bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Shiva, who assumes the form of Bala, is called the cause of victory.

original: gti mug der ni sgrub byed yin //
analyzed: gti mug der ni sgrub byed yin //
translated: Delusion is the means of accomplishing it.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpyid kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'i khyab 'jug gi don thams cad grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpyid kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'i khyab 'jug gi don thams cad grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Vishnu, who assumes the form of Vasanta, is called the accomplishment of all goals.

original: kun du gsang ba'i ming yin @3b no ;
analyzed: kun du gsang ba'i ming yin @3b no ;
translated: This is the secret name.

original: / zhes bya ba ni skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin gyi phyogs bcu thams cad du rnal 'byor pa nyid la ming 'di dag grags pa yin no //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin gyi phyogs bcu thams cad du rnal 'byor pa nyid la ming 'di dag grags pa yin no //
translated: This is the secret name of the yogin himself, not common to all people, and these names are renowned in all the ten directions.

original: nga ni 'jig rten gcig pu nyid //
analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten gcig pu nyid //
translated: I alone am the world.

original: ces bya ba ni sems tsam gyi tshul gyis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug nyid 'jig rten yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sems tsam gyi tshul gyis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug nyid 'jig rten yin no //
translated: By the method of mind-only, attachment, aversion, and delusion themselves are the world.

original: 'jig rten gsum du rab tu bshad /üîΩces bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i tshul gyis ni 'dod chags ni tshang ba zhe sdang ni drag po gti mug ni khyab 'jug yin no zhes rab tu bshad cing ngas ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis bskyed de bshad pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du rab tu bshad / ces bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i tshul gyis ni 'dod chags ni tshang ba zhe sdang ni drag po gti mug ni khyab 'jug yin no zhes rab tu bshad cing ngas ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis bskyed de bshad pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo
translated: I am well known in the three worlds.

original: rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
analyzed: rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
translated: By the method of analysis, attachment is Vi·π£·πáu, aversion is Rudra, and delusion is BrahmƒÅ. I am well known as such, and I, the Blessed One Vajradhara, have explained this by the power of samƒÅdhi.

original: yang de ltar rnam par shes pa tsam du ni gcig tu zad la /
analyzed: yang de ltar rnam par shes pa tsam du ni gcig tu zad la /
translated: Thus, consciousness is just one,

original: de dbye ba'i tshul gyis ni rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de dbye ba'i tshul gyis ni rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it to be understood that it is established by the method of its divisions?

original: nga ni 'dod pa gcig pu nyid //
analyzed: nga ni 'dod pa gcig pu nyid //
translated: I am the one desire.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩBecause I am the dharma realm, by the nature of its beginninglessness and endlessness, I am ultimately one.

original: gang gi phyir nga ni chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni don dam par gcig pu nyid yin zhing byang chub kyi mtshan ma ming can gyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pas na 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nga ni chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni don dam par gcig pu nyid yin zhing byang chub kyi mtshan ma ming can gyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pas na 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Since I am the nature of mind, which is the sign of enlightenment, I am desire.

original: 'di'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs can gyi tshangs pa yin pas na 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs can gyi tshangs pa yin pas na 'dod pa'o //
translated: Since I am Brahma, who has the form of a desire god, who is born from my similar cause, I am desire.

original: drag po ni stobs bzangs kyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: drag po ni stobs bzangs kyi gzugs can no //
translated: Rudra has the form of Bala.

original: g-yung drung ni dpyid kyi gzugs can khyab 'jug go //
analyzed: g-yung drung ni dpyid kyi gzugs can khyab 'jug go //
translated: Visnu has the form of Vasanta.

original: de bas na rgyu gcig gi rgyu mthun las byung ba nyid kyis na 'jig rten gsum po 'di dag gcig pu nyid yin no zhes rdo rje 'chang chen pos rab tu bshad cing gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gsum gyi de kho na nyid bshad nas de'i rjes thogs nyid la /
translated: Thus, after explaining the reality of the three worlds, immediately after that,

original: ming po gsum po 'di'i mchog rdo rje 'chang dngos por 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa yang spang pas byang chub kyi mtshan can gyi sems rtogs pa ni sbyangs pa ste /

translated: In order to purify those, the BhagavƒÅn, Vajradhara the Great, having blessed himself as the three forms, purified the minds of those sentient beings who are attached to things, and in order to attain buddhahood,

original: da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor la lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor la lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to take care of those sentient beings who have special devotion to the mandalas of all mundane and supramundane deities,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the concise mandala is taught, beginning with then, and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthen‚Äù is a word that shows immediately after.

original: dang po'i sbyor pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: It is immediately after the first yoga.

original: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen por gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen por gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the samadhi of the first yoga is taught in the great mandala of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: kun mchog dam pa'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: kun mchog dam pa'i dbang phyug ste //
translated: The sovereign of all, the holy of holies,

original: zhes bya ba ni kun gyi mchog kyang yin la dam pa'i dbang phyug kyang yin pas na kun mchog dbang phyug ste dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun gyi mchog kyang yin la dam pa'i dbang phyug kyang yin pas na kun mchog dbang phyug ste dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: is the sovereign of all, the holy of holies, glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de yang thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na kun mchog go //
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na kun mchog go //
translated: He is the sovereign of all because he is the best of all.

original: de nyid ni dam pa ste phul du byung ba yin zhing khams gsum pa ma lus pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid la mnga' brnyes pas na dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de nyid ni dam pa ste phul du byung ba yin zhing khams gsum pa ma lus pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid la mnga' brnyes pas na dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the holy of holies, the most excellent, and he is the sovereign because he has attained dominion over the entire Dharma of the three realms.

original: sems can don kun rab sgrub byed //
analyzed: sems can don kun rab sgrub byed //
translated: He accomplishes all the aims of sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba ni rigs lnga'i lha rnams kyis 'dul pa'i sems can kun yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rigs lnga'i lha rnams kyis 'dul pa'i sems can kun yin te /
translated: All sentient beings to be tamed are the deities of the five families.

original: de rnams kyi rab tu sgrub pa ni rigs lnga rtogs par gyur pa ste de'i don du'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rab tu sgrub pa ni rigs lnga rtogs par gyur pa ste de'i don du'o //
translated: Their full accomplishment is the realization of the five clans, and for that purpose

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad gsungs pa yin //
translated: all mandalas have been taught.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom @7b ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang bas bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom @7b ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang bas bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the mandala of the gathered retinue by the Lord Vajradhara.

original: gzugs kun gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs kun gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams kyi gzugs so //
translated: All forms are the forms of the mundane and supramundane deities.

original: dus gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe zhe na /

original: gang tshe gsang ba chen po lnga'o //
analyzed: gang tshe gsang ba chen po lnga'o //

original: gsang ba chen po'i de kho na nyid lnga ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / nor bu'i rigs rnams kyis gang gi tshe 'dul bar ma gyur pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dam rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid la 'jog par mi nus pa de'i tshe sna tshogs chen po bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis 'dul ba'i skye bo skal pa dang ldan pa rnams la dam
analyzed: gsang ba chen po'i de kho na nyid lnga ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / nor bu'i rigs rnams kyis gang gi tshe 'dul bar ma gyur pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dam rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid la 'jog par mi nus pa de'i tshe sna tshogs chen po bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis 'dul ba'i skye bo skal pa dang ldan pa rnams la dam
translated: When they are unable to establish even buddhahood or the state of Vajradhara for those who are not disciplined, then they discipline those who are fortunate with the mandala of the great variety.

original: pa ste / mchog 'di mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ste / mchog 'di mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This is the supreme activity.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

analyzed: sna tshogs chen po /

analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dam pa yin //

analyzed: bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor dam pa ste mchog tu gyur pas rab tu phye ste bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //

original: kun mchog ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul yang dag par ston pa yin zhes gang du 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams rnams las rnam bar rgyal ba yin bas na kun mchog rnam rgyal lo //

translated: Then one should seal with the great seal of Vajrasattva and so forth, the Dharma and Action [seals].

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni rang gi dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya rnams kyis dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni rang gi dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya rnams kyis dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then Vajrasattva and so forth should be empowered with the seals of their own consecrations.

original: rdo rje sred med kyi bu la sogs pa bzhi ni rdo rje rin chen gyi phyag rgyas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sred med kyi bu la sogs pa bzhi ni rdo rje rin chen gyi phyag rgyas dbang bskur ro //
translated: The four, Vajraramana and so forth, should be empowered with the jewel seal of Vajraratna.

original: de nas slob dpon gyi cho ga thams cad snga ma bzhin du rjes su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyi cho ga thams cad snga ma bzhin du rjes su spyad par bya'o //
translated: Then the master should perform all the rites as before.

original: rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa las khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa las khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference from the explanation of the mandala of the five clans is this.

original: ji ltar bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i cho gas bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i cho gas bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Just as in the mandala of four, one should enter the mandala of the concise mandala with the song of offering of entering the mandala as explained in the Vajrasattva mandala.

original: de'i rjes la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du rang gi cho gas so //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du rang gi cho gas so //
translated: After that, in the mandala of Vajrasattva and so forth, one should enter with one's own rite.

original: slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga rgyas pa'o //
translated: The extensive ritual action of the master is complete.

original: de nas slob ma bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa'i klu'i mchod pa bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du bcug la /
analyzed: de nas slob ma bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa'i klu'i mchod pa bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du bcug la /
translated: Then, having caused the disciples to enter the mandala of the four nƒÅga worship explained in the concise mandala,

original: de'i 'og tu rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gas rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gas rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad par bya'o //
translated: after that, one should perform all the rites of causing them to enter the mandala of the five families according to the rite of the mandala of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rdzogs so //
analyzed: slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rdzogs so //
translated: The rite of causing the disciples to enter and so forth is complete.

original: bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad par rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad par rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the concise mandala is complete.

original: // / rtog pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na rtog pa thams cad de /
analyzed: // / rtog pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na rtog pa thams cad de /
translated: Since it is a conception and also all, it is all conceptions.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu po bshad ma thag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu po bshad ma thag pa nyid do //
translated: It is the ten mandalas of Vajrasattva and so forth that were just explained.

original: de nyid ni rgyud phyi ma yin la de bas na rtsa ba'i rgyud yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni rgyud phyi ma yin la de bas na rtsa ba'i rgyud yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: That is the continuation of the tantra, and therefore the root tantra is complete.

original: de ltar rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud bshad nas da ni de las kyi sgrib pa'i dbang gis rnal 'byor @12b pas ma grub na /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud bshad nas da ni de las kyi sgrib pa'i dbang gis rnal 'byor @12b pas ma grub na /
translated: As such, having explained the tantra of all concepts and the rootüîΩtantra, now, if the yogi is not successful due to the power of karmicüîΩobscurations,

original: gsang ba'i le'u'i dkyil 'khor 'dod pa'i dngos grub thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsang ba'i le'u'i dkyil 'khor 'dod pa'i dngos grub thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the continuation of the tantra of all concepts and the root tantra, now, in order to teach the special nature of the accomplishment of all desired powers of the ma·πá·∏çala of the chapter on the secret for the yogi/nƒ´ who is not successful due to the power of karmic obscurations,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚Äúall buddhas,‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kun ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste /
translated: All buddhas are Vairocana and so on, equal to the particles of all world systems.

original: de rnams kyi gsang ba yang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas gsang ba che ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gsang ba yang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas gsang ba che ste /
translated: That is the great secret, because it is the secret of all of them.

original: skye bo thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i lha mo bzhi dang lhan cig tu bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i lha mo bzhi dang lhan cig tu bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Vajrasattva is the one who resides with the four goddesses who are not shared with all people.

original: dam tshig mchog ces bya ba ni de nyid dam tshig kyang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na dam tshig mchog go //
analyzed: dam tshig mchog ces bya ba ni de nyid dam tshig kyang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na dam tshig mchog go //
translated: The supreme commitment is the commitment that is supreme.

original: de'i sgrub pa ni dpal dgyes pa chen po'i gnas te der bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa ni dpal dgyes pa chen po'i gnas te der bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Its practice is the abode of the great glorious one, and he resides there.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rgyal po mchog ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyal po mchog ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with the supreme king.

original: slar yang gnas kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slar yang gnas kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, in order to teach the special abode, he declares the great bliss, etc.

original: bde ba chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The great bliss is Vajrasattva.

original: de'i gzhal yas khang pa ni bde ba chen po'i gzhal yas khang pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhal yas khang pa ni bde ba chen po'i gzhal yas khang pa'o //
translated: His celestial mansion is the great bliss celestial mansion.

original: dngos grub kun gyi ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams te /
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams te /
translated: All powers are the powers of the great seal, etc.

original: de dag gis mngon par 'du byas pa ni rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: de dag gis mngon par 'du byas pa ni rdzogs pa'am /
translated: They are fully accomplished by it.

original: de'i don du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dus te byon pa ni /
analyzed: de'i don du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dus te byon pa ni /
translated: For that purpose, the Tathagatas, equal to the atoms of all the world-realms, such as Vairocana, etc., have come together.

original: de bzhin gshegs mchog chen po'i rin chen rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs mchog chen po'i rin chen rgyal po'o //
translated: The great supreme Tathagata is the king of jewels.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzungs dang / rig pa dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzungs dang / rig pa dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be taken to include the dharanis, the vidyas, the great Vajradhara, Maitreya, and other Bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs mchog chen po yi //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs mchog chen po yi //
translated: The great supreme TathagataüîΩis the king of jewels, etc.

original: rin chen rgyal po la sogs pa de rnams kyis brgyan pa de yin no //üîΩbde ba chen po chags pa che ;
analyzed: rin chen rgyal po la sogs pa de rnams kyis brgyan pa de yin no // bde ba chen po chags pa che ;
translated: He is adorned by them.üîΩHe is the great bliss, the great passion.

original: / zhes bya ba la bde ba chen po yang yin la chags pa chen po yang yin pas na /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la bde ba chen po yang yin la chags pa chen po yang yin pas na /
translated: He is the great bliss, and he is the great passion.

original: bde ba chen po chags pa che ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po chags pa che ste /
translated: He is the great bliss, the great passion.

original: lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na bzhugs pa'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na bzhugs pa'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He is the glorious Vajrasattva, who resides in the center of the mandala of goddesses.

original: dngos grub kun la rjes chags phyir //
analyzed: dngos grub kun la rjes chags phyir //
translated: Because of his passion for all powers,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni chags pa che //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni chags pa che //
translated: the Lord is of great passion.

original: dmar @13a * //
analyzed: dmar @13a * //
translated: Red,

original: dang sna tshogs mdzes pa'i 'od //
analyzed: dang sna tshogs mdzes pa'i 'od //
translated: with a beautiful light of various colors,

original: dpal rdor sems dpa'i phyag rgya 'di //üîΩzhes 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal rdor sems dpa'i phyag rgya 'di // zhes 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this is the seal of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de'i glu ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can yi ge h'um gi glu dang rol mo ste /üîΩde dag gi rjes su chags pa ni rjes su sgrub pa bde ba chen po chags pa chen po'i glu dang rol mo rjes su chags pa gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de'i glu ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can yi ge h'um gi glu dang rol mo ste / de dag gi rjes su chags pa ni rjes su sgrub pa bde ba chen po chags pa chen po'i glu dang rol mo rjes su chags pa gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: The song of Vajrasattva is the song of the syllable h≈´·πÉ and the music that have the characteristics to be explained below.

original: bla med dga' ba chen po yi //
analyzed: bla med dga' ba chen po yi //
translated: Passion for them is the practice of great passion, the great bliss, the song and music of passion. He who has that is called this.

original: mchod pa kun gyis rab tu mchod //
analyzed: mchod pa kun gyis rab tu mchod //
translated: He is worshipped with all the offeringsüîΩof the highest great joy.

original: ces bya ba la bla na med pa'i dga' ba chen po'i yid bde bas 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa bcu gnyis dang / phyi'i me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa thams cad kyis rab tu mchod pa gang yin pa der ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba la bla na med pa'i dga' ba chen po'i yid bde bas 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa bcu gnyis dang / phyi'i me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa thams cad kyis rab tu mchod pa gang yin pa der ro //
translated: In this verse, he is worshipped with the twelve offerings of Rati-vajra, etc. , and with all the outer offerings of flowers, etc. , by the mind of supreme delight and bliss.

original: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba la /
translated: Great delight means

original: chen po ni byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi thugs dang sems can gyi don la chags pas ni dga' ba chen pos rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi thugs dang sems can gyi don la chags pas ni dga' ba chen pos rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: that he is Vajrasattva, the great delight of the great delight of the mind characterized by enlightenment, and of the attachment to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de'i dpal gyi gnas ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i gzhal yas khang pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dpal gyi gnas ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i gzhal yas khang pa'o //
translated: His palace is the celestial mansion endowed with the host of goddesses beginning with Rati-vajra.

original: de lta bu'i gnas kyi mchog de la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas kyi mchog de la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One dwells in such a supreme palace.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rgyal po mchog / ces bya ba ni ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rgyal po mchog / ces bya ba ni ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du'o //
translated: The supreme king of supreme delight is as explained.

original: mi 'gyur mchog ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mchog ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The supreme unchanging is permanent.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag rang nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag rang nyid //
translated: Vajrasattva is myself.

original: rab tu dga' ba mi 'gyur mchog / kun du bzang po 'khor ba dang // byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba mi 'gyur mchog / kun du bzang po 'khor ba dang // byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The supreme joy of the highest stage, Samantabhadra, the wheel, the bodhisattva, and the Tathagata.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.üîΩThe supreme of all great powers,

original: dngos grub chen po kun gyi mchog / ces bya ba la dngos grub kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas dngos grub chen po ste /
analyzed: dngos grub chen po kun gyi mchog / ces bya ba la dngos grub kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas dngos grub chen po ste /
translated: is a great power because it is a power and it is great.

original: de nyid thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na /
analyzed: de nyid thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na /
translated: It is the supreme of all because it is the supreme of all.

original: dngos grub kun gyi mchog ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi mchog ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: The supreme of all powers is the power of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: des rdo rje snyems pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po dang lha mo rdo rje snyems ma'i bdag po ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub chen po'i thugs kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: des rdo rje snyems pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po dang lha mo rdo rje snyems ma'i bdag po ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub chen po'i thugs kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: By that, the vajra conceit is the great seal of Vajrasattva, and the lord of the goddess Vajra Nairatmya is the Bhagavat, the nature of the mind of great enlightenment, the great Vajradhara.

original: de nyid rigs kyi lha mo thams cad byang chub sems las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rigs kyi lha mo thams cad byang chub sems las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: That is the nature of all the goddesses of the families, because they arise from the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyi yang bdag po yin no zhes bya ba bdag po'i sgra gnyis pas bstan pa @13b yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang bdag po yin no zhes bya ba bdag po'i sgra gnyis pas bstan pa @13b yin no //
translated: The second term ‚Äúlord‚Äù indicates that he is the master of those.

original: de ltar na thams cad ces bya ba nas bdag po'i bdag ces bya ba'i bar du bshad pas ting nge 'dzin dang po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad ces bya ba nas bdag po'i bdag ces bya ba'i bar du bshad pas ting nge 'dzin dang po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the first meditative absorption is taught by the passage beginning with ‚Äúall‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúlord of the self.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na kun mchog go //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na kun mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme of all mundane and supramundane gods, thus he is the ‚Äúsupreme of all.‚Äù

original: kun mchog kyang yin la chags pa chen po yang de nyid yin pas kun mchog chags pa chen po'o //
analyzed: kun mchog kyang yin la chags pa chen po yang de nyid yin pas kun mchog chags pa chen po'o //
translated: He is the supreme of all and also the great passion, thus he is the ‚Äúgreat passion of the supreme of all.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos grub ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos grub ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rdzogs pa'o //
translated: His ‚Äúperfection‚Äù is the completion in the mind-stream of the person to be trained.

original: des gdul bya de ma lus shing lus ba med pa'i khams gsum gyi bdag po nyid do //
analyzed: des gdul bya de ma lus shing lus ba med pa'i khams gsum gyi bdag po nyid do //
translated: By that, he is the lord of the entire, i.e., the entire, without exception, three realms of those to be trained.

original: de'i rjes su sgrub pa ni rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su sgrub pa ni rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: His ‚Äúaccomplishment‚Äù is the completion of that.

original: glu dang rol mo zhes bya ba'i yi ge h'um gi glu gsungs pa dang / pi wang la sogs pa'i rol mo ston par byed pa'i h'um ste de nyid rol mo'o //
analyzed: glu dang rol mo zhes bya ba'i yi ge h'um gi glu gsungs pa dang / pi wang la sogs pa'i rol mo ston par byed pa'i h'um ste de nyid rol mo'o //
translated: The syllable HUM is the song and music, the song of the syllable HUM, and the music of the lute, etc.

original: de nyid ni don dam par dbus dang mtha' med pa'i thog mtha' med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni don dam par dbus dang mtha' med pa'i thog mtha' med pa ste /
translated: That very [syllable] is ultimately without middle or end, without beginning or end.

original: sngar gsungs pa yin yang sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis slar yang gsungs pa yin no//
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa yin yang sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis slar yang gsungs pa yin no//
translated: Although it was previously mentioned, it is mentioned again due to the difference in application.

original: de gang yin zhe na h'um zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na h'um zhes pa'o //
translated: What is that? It is the syllable HUM.

original: de thams cad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de thams cad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: All of those are called graspers.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / chags pa'i rdo rje ma dang / k'i li k'i la dang / rdo rje dran ma dang / rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i ye shes rnams ni rdo rje thams cad do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / chags pa'i rdo rje ma dang / k'i li k'i la dang / rdo rje dran ma dang / rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i ye shes rnams ni rdo rje thams cad do //
translated: The wisdoms of the same taste as the suchness of Vajrasattva, Passion Vajrƒ´, Kali Kali, Vajra Sm·πõti, and Vajra KƒÅmadhenu are all vajras.

original: de rnams dang rgyu mthun pa'i dang po'i rdo rje ni rdo rje thams cad do //
analyzed: de rnams dang rgyu mthun pa'i dang po'i rdo rje ni rdo rje thams cad do //

original: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin pas te /
analyzed: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin pas te /
translated: Because he holds those, he is the Vajra Holder.

original: rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa de yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa de yin no //
translated: He is the holder of all vajras.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is a restriction.

original: rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa kho na'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa kho na'o zhes bya'o //
translated: He is the holder of all vajras only.

original: gsang ba lnga yi de nyid che //
analyzed: gsang ba lnga yi de nyid che //
translated: The great reality of the five secrets

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang / de so sor rtog pa dang / mngon du bya ba dang / yongs su mi spang ba dang / thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang / de so sor rtog pa dang / mngon du bya ba dang / yongs su mi spang ba dang / thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes rnams so //
translated: refers to the wisdoms characterized by the spirit of enlightenment, its discernment, its realization, its non-abandonment, and its attainment.

original: de las byung ba'i dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod pa'i chags pa'i dam tshig gis 'dod pa'i rdo rje mal sogs pa lha mo bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod pa'i chags pa'i dam tshig gis 'dod pa'i rdo rje mal sogs pa lha mo bzhi pa'o //
translated: The four goddesses beginning with R≈´pavajrƒÅ are the great joy arising from that, the pledge of glorious Vajradharma‚Äôs passion.

original: rdo rje mda' la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa rnams ni gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i phyag rgya'i lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje mda' la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa rnams ni gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i phyag rgya'i lha mo rnams so //
translated: The goddesses of the seals of the great reality of the five secrets are indicated by the vajra arrow, etc.

original: de dag rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams las byung ba yin no //
translated: They arise from the vajra body, speech, and mind of the holder of all vajras.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rdo rje 'chang ni chen po @14a * //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ni chen po @14a * //
translated: Vajradhara is the greatüîΩone.

original: yi ; / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las //
analyzed: yi ; / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las //
translated: From the vajra of body, speech, and mind

original: de nyid phyag rgya byung ba yin //
analyzed: de nyid phyag rgya byung ba yin //
translated: of him, the seal arises.

original: zhes 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated below.

original: rtag pa yang yin la chags pa yang de nyid yin pas rtag tu chags pas te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang yin la chags pa yang de nyid yin pas rtag tu chags pas te /
translated: He is permanent and also attached, thus he is permanently attached.

original: de ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa kun mchog so sor rtog pa'i lha mo'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa kun mchog so sor rtog pa'i lha mo'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the one who always abides by the nature of having arisen in that way, having the form of the goddess of discernment, the supreme of all.

original: dngos grub kyang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas na dngos grub chen po ste /
analyzed: dngos grub kyang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas na dngos grub chen po ste /
translated: Siddhi is also great, thus it is great siddhi.

original: byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba mngon du bya ba'i dngos grub thams cad kyi bde ba dam pa'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba mngon du bya ba'i dngos grub thams cad kyi bde ba dam pa'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the one who has the form of the supreme bliss of all siddhis that are to be manifested, which have the character of great enlightenment, and of the mind and mental factors.

original: rnam rgyal ni lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin dag pa'i so sor rtogs nas spang ba'am mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas 'chi bdag gi bdud las rnam par rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: rnam rgyal ni lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin dag pa'i so sor rtogs nas spang ba'am mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas 'chi bdag gi bdud las rnam par rgyal ba ste /
translated: Victory is the transcendence of sorrow that does not abide, which is the victory over the demon of death by the purification of the nature of the sixty-two views.

original: kun mchog rnam par rgyal ba mthong ba'i lha mo'i gzugs can sems dpa'o //
analyzed: kun mchog rnam par rgyal ba mthong ba'i lha mo'i gzugs can sems dpa'o //
translated: The supreme of all is the bodhisattva who has the form of the goddess of the great worship of victory.

original: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag po nyid de /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag po nyid de /
translated: Sovereignty is the state of being the lord of all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: thams cad kyi dbang phyug mchod pa chen po'i lha mo'i gzugs can bcom ldan 'das yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dbang phyug mchod pa chen po'i lha mo'i gzugs can bcom ldan 'das yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has the form of the goddess of the great worship of sovereignty.üîΩConstantly attached, great power, victory, and sovereignty

original: rtag tu chags pa dang / dngos grub chen po dang rnam par rgyal ba dang dbang phyug ni /üîΩrtag tu chags dang dngos grub che //
analyzed: rtag tu chags pa dang / dngos grub chen po dang rnam par rgyal ba dang dbang phyug ni / rtag tu chags dang dngos grub che //
translated: are the great lords.üîΩConstantly attached, great power,

original: rnam rgyal dbang phyug che rnams so //
analyzed: rnam rgyal dbang phyug che rnams so //
translated: victory, and great sovereignty.

original: de rnams kyi lhag pa'i lha ni lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lhag pa'i lha ni lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: Their supreme deity is the supreme deity.

original: de dag gang yin zhe na bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gang yin zhe na bzhi po rnams so //
translated: What are they? They are the four.

original: phyag rgya dam pa zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dam pa zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúhighest seal‚Äù is the most excellent.

original: phyag rgya dam pa bzhi po de dag ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya dam pa bzhi po de dag ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are those four highest seals?

original: sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sku zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sku zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe form blessed by the bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: Vajrasattva is the vajra being.

original: des byin gyis brlabs pa ni brtan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pa ni brtan par bya ba ste /
translated: Blessed by him is the firm one.

original: de'i don du rig pa'i lha mo sku gzugs can yin pas na sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sku gzugs yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du rig pa'i lha mo sku gzugs can yin pas na sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sku gzugs yin no //
translated: For that purpose, the knowledge goddess is the form, so it is the form blessed by the bodhisattva.

original: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: 'di rnams dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: These are the limbs of glorious Vajrasattva.üîΩThe supreme of all is the highest.

original: kun mchog so sor rtog pa dang // zhes bya ba la thams cad kyi mchog ni kun mchog ste /
analyzed: kun mchog so sor rtog pa dang // zhes bya ba la thams cad kyi mchog ni kun mchog ste /
translated: The supreme of all is the highest.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings byang chub chen po'i thugs kyi rang bzhin can rdo rje @14b sems dpa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings byang chub chen po'i thugs kyi rang bzhin can rdo rje @14b sems dpa'o //
translated: The beginningless and endless realm of phenomena, the nature of the mind of great enlightenment, is Vajrasattva.

original: de'i so sor rtog pa ni de'i rang bzhin mngon du byed pa'i gzugs can chos bdag med pa bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can 'dod chags rdo rje ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i so sor rtog pa ni de'i rang bzhin mngon du byed pa'i gzugs can chos bdag med pa bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can 'dod chags rdo rje ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The discernment of that is the nature of the meditation on the selflessness of phenomena, which is the nature of the form of the manifestation of that nature.

original: dngos grub kun gyi bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ba la dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mngon sum du bya ba gang yin pa de ni dngos grub kun te de nyid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ba la dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mngon sum du bya ba gang yin pa de ni dngos grub kun te de nyid bde ba'o //
translated: The supreme bliss of all powers is the supreme bliss of the glorious Vajrasattva, which is the direct realization of the nature of mind and mental factors by the yogi/nƒ´.

original: gzugs des mchog ni bcom ldan 'das ma k'i li k'i la'o //üîΩkun mchog rnam rgyal mthong ba ma //
analyzed: gzugs des mchog ni bcom ldan 'das ma k'i li k'i la'o // kun mchog rnam rgyal mthong ba ma //
translated: The supreme form of that is the Bhagavatƒ´ Kali.

original: zhes bya ba la de nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin gang rnal 'byor pas rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni kun mchog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin gang rnal 'byor pas rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni kun mchog ste /
translated: The supreme of all, the all-victorious, is the vision of the non-dual nature of mind and mental factors of the glorious Vajrasattva, which is realized by the yogi/nƒ´.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the most excellent of all mundane and supramundane pristine awarenesses.

original: des rnam par rgyal ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud las rnam par rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: des rnam par rgyal ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud las rnam par rgyal ba ste /
translated: Victory over that is the abandonment of attachment, etc., together with their instincts, and victory over the demon of death.

original: de'i mtho ba'i yang mtho ba ste /
analyzed: de'i mtho ba'i yang mtho ba ste /
translated: That is the highest of the high.

original: de las byung ba'i rgyal ba'i ba dan gyis nye bar mtshon pa /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rgyal ba'i ba dan gyis nye bar mtshon pa /
translated: The banner of victory that arises from that is indicated.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje dran pa'o //üîΩthams cad dbang phyug mchod pa che //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje dran pa'o // thams cad dbang phyug mchod pa che //
translated: It is the Blessed Lady, Vajra Smrti.üîΩThe great worship of the Lord of All

original: zhes bya ba la thams cad kyang yin la dbang phyug kyang de nyid yin pas na thams cad dbang phyug ste /üîΩsangs rgyas sprul pa dang / sems can gyi don mdzad pa la bdag po nyid do //üîΩde yi mchod pa chen po ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thams cad kyang yin la dbang phyug kyang de nyid yin pas na thams cad dbang phyug ste / sangs rgyas sprul pa dang / sems can gyi don mdzad pa la bdag po nyid do // de yi mchod pa chen po ni //
translated: is the great worship of the Lord of All,üîΩthe Blessed Lady, Vajra Rati.

original: thams cad dbang phyug mchod pa che ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad dbang phyug mchod pa che ba ste /
translated: The great worship of the Lord of All is the great worship of the Lord of All.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: It is the Blessed Lady, Vajra Rati.

original: dngos grub ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: dngos grub ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The so-called powers are all mundane and supramundane powers, by means of the form of Rativajra.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin can gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni k'i li k'i la ma'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin can gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni k'i li k'i la ma'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: All perfections having the nature of the experience of bliss and mental joy are by means of the form of Kilikili.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal ba las 'dod pa'i 'byung ba'i dga' ba thams cad ni rdo rje dran pa ma'i gzugs kyis so //üîΩthams cad kyi bdag po nyid kyi rang @15a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal ba las 'dod pa'i 'byung ba'i dga' ba thams cad ni rdo rje dran pa ma'i gzugs kyis so // thams cad kyi bdag po nyid kyi rang @15a * //
translated: All the joys of the arising of desire from the conquest of passion and so forth are by means of the form of Vajrasmrti.

original: bzhin can gyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: bzhin can gyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The nature of the Lord, who is the Lord of all, is by means of the form of Vajrarati-Isvari.

original: rdo rje lha mo thog mtha' med //
analyzed: rdo rje lha mo thog mtha' med //
translated: The Vajra Goddess is without beginning or end.

original: ces pa ni dbus dang mtha' dang bral ba da ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni dbus dang mtha' dang bral ba da ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa ste /
translated: This means that she always abides by the nature of the present, free from middle and end.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i mchog gi sku de rnams yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i mchog gi sku de rnams yin no //
translated: These are the supreme bodies of the Blessed One, Vajrasattva.

original: slar yang de dag gsang ba'i mchog gi mtshan rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slar yang de dag gsang ba'i mchog gi mtshan rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to teach the names of those secret supreme ones,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThen, the Blessed One, the Great Joy, the glorious Vajrasattva,üîΩwas pleased with the pledge of Vajraraga, and the Blessed Lady Desire Vajra arose from his mind.

original: dga' ba chen po yang yin la dpal rdo rje don yod kyang de nyid yin pas na dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod de rdo rje sems dpa'o //üîΩde la chags pa ni dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po yang yin la dpal rdo rje don yod kyang de nyid yin pas na dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod de rdo rje sems dpa'o // de la chags pa ni dga' ba ste /
translated: The Great Joy is also glorious Vajrasattva, therefore, it is the Great Joy, the glorious Vajrasattva, which is Vajrasattva.

original: de'i dam tshig ni 'dod pa'i rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni 'dod pa'i rdo rje ma'o //
translated: The pledge of that is the desire vajra.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs kyi dgyes pa skyed par byed pas rgyur gyur pa byang chub sems bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can du thugs gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa bcom ldan 'das ma 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs kyi dgyes pa skyed par byed pas rgyur gyur pa byang chub sems bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can du thugs gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa bcom ldan 'das ma 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady Desire Vajra is the nature of the meditation on the bodhicitta, which is the cause of generating the joy of the mind of Vajrasattva, and the mind of the Blessed One does not change to another.

original: dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod pa la chags pa skyed pa'i phyir rgyu'i dam tshig rnam par grol ba'i las kyi rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje k'i li k'i la ste /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod pa la chags pa skyed pa'i phyir rgyu'i dam tshig rnam par grol ba'i las kyi rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje k'i li k'i la ste /
translated: The Blessed Lady Vajra Kali is the cause of generating the desire of the Great Joy, the glorious Vajrasattva, and the nature of the action of liberation is the pledge.

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i yid bde ba dang yid bde bar mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i yid bde ba dang yid bde bar mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Blessed One is the nature of the indivisibility of the mental bliss and mental satisfaction of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Great joy, etc., are as before.

original: de'i dga' ba'i dam tshig ni dga' ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de'i dga' ba'i dam tshig ni dga' ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: His pledge of joy is the cause of joy,

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i rdo rje ma ste 'dod chags la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal bas mi phyed pa rdo rje dran pa ma'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i rdo rje ma ste 'dod chags la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal bas mi phyed pa rdo rje dran pa ma'o //
translated: Vajra-VijayƒÅ, who is indivisible from Vajra-Sm·πõti, because she is victorious over passion, etc.

original: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: Great joy, etc., are as before.

original: rdo rje 'dod pa ni thams cad las su rung ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams gang dag bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas sprul pa de rnams kyi dbang phyug ma gang yin pa de ni rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dod pa ni thams cad las su rung ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams gang dag bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas sprul pa de rnams kyi dbang phyug ma gang yin pa de ni rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma ste /
translated: Vajra-desire is the serviceability of all forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and objects of touch, which are emanated by the Blessed One Vajrasattva. The queen of those is Vajra-Desire-Queen.

original: dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod la ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / gdul bya rnams kyi dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po dpal rdo rje don yod la ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / gdul bya rnams kyi dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For the great joy, glorious Vajra Amogha, the cause is Vajrasattva, because he generates the joy of those to be trained.

original: 'di rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i mtshan rnams la dad cing lhag par mos nas mtshan gyi don gang zhig bud med @15b dam ;
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i mtshan rnams la dad cing lhag par mos nas mtshan gyi don gang zhig bud med @15b dam ;
translated: In these and so forth, having had faith and conviction in the names just explained of the goddesses such as Passion Vajra, the meaning of the name is that any woman,

original: skyes pa'am / khye'u'am /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / khye'u'am /
translated: man, boy,

original: bu mo'am / gang zag mkhas pa gang /
analyzed: bu mo'am / gang zag mkhas pa gang /
translated: girl, or wise person

original: mtshan gyi don shes pas klog pa de ni de nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan gyi don shes pas klog pa de ni de nyid do //
translated: who reads with knowledge of the meaning of the name is that very [Vajrasattva].

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyag rgya thams cad ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi bdag po rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyag rgya thams cad ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi bdag po rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the mudras who are not others, the great mudras such as Passion Vajra, become the lord of the powers of Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar na kun mchog chags pa chen po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar na kun mchog chags pa chen po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with the supreme of all, great passion,

original: gsang ba'i mchog ces bya ba ni bar du bstan pas /
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchog ces bya ba ni bar du bstan pas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe supreme secret‚Äù refers to the middle teaching.

original: ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa bstan to //

translated: The accomplishment and so forth have been explained.üîΩOne should draw the mandala every day, and practice the accomplishment for seven days, as long as one accomplishes the mandala, if the yogi has previously performed the familiarization practice. Then one will be successful.

analyzed: mtshan thog thag bsgom par bya ste /
