analyzed: de la dza: zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i kun mchog so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam bstan pa yin no //
translated: There, J is the path characterized by the discernment of the supreme of all, beginning with glorious Vajrasattva.

original: mchog ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the beginningless and endless.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa nas sngon du yang da ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa nas sngon du yang da ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The first is the one who has existed from the beginning of the good eon and so forth, in the nature of the present.

original: lam de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: lam de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: He is the Vajra Holder because he holds the vajra of suchness, the nature of that very path.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas @22b bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas @22b bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He is the Vajrasattva because he cannot be moved by the concepts of subject and object.

original: mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'chang yang de yin la rdo rje sems dpa' yang de nyid yin pas na mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'chang gi rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'chang yang de yin la rdo rje sems dpa' yang de nyid yin pas na mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'chang gi rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He is the supreme first Vajradhara, and he is also Vajrasattva, therefore he is the Vajrasattva of the supreme first Vajradhara.

original: bde ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa rab tu rtogs par mdzod cig ces sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la bod pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa rab tu rtogs par mdzod cig ces sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la bod pa'o //
translated: He is the bliss, the realization of the uncontaminated realm of phenomena, which is supreme among all, without beginning or end.  Thus he is addressed by the Buddha Bhagavat Vajrasattva.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'chang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'chang bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the Buddha is taught to be Vajradhara,

original: 'dir 'dod chags rdo rje'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags rdo rje'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' yin no //
translated: and here, he is Vajrasattva, whose nature is the vajra of passion.

original: h'um zhes bya ba'i 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi sku mchog so sor rtog pa'i mtshan can gyi lam gyi yul du byas pa'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba'i 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi sku mchog so sor rtog pa'i mtshan can gyi lam gyi yul du byas pa'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa'o //
translated: The supreme body of Humkara, whose nature is the passion vajra, is realized as the essence of uncontaminated bliss and mental satisfaction, which is made into the object of the path characterized by discernment.

original: de nyid mchog ste phul du byung ba'i rdo rje ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin can gyi las mngon du bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid mchog ste phul du byung ba'i rdo rje ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin can gyi las mngon du bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That is the supreme, the best, vajra, which is the nature of the activity that is the nature of RƒÅgavajrƒÅ.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gsungs te /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate what kind of distinction it has, he says the distinction of supreme, etc.

original: mchog kyang yin la mi 'gyur ba yang de nyid yin pas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba ste thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o//
analyzed: mchog kyang yin la mi 'gyur ba yang de nyid yin pas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba ste thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o//
translated: It is supreme and unchanging, thus it is supremely unchanging, without beginning or end.

original: de zag pa med pa'i srid pa rab tu bsgrub pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: de zag pa med pa'i srid pa rab tu bsgrub pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of that uncontaminated existence is the establishment of non-abiding nirvana.

original: zag pa med pa'i srid pa rab tu bsgrub pa de'i don du zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin can gyi dam tshig dang po ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste de'i las so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i srid pa rab tu bsgrub pa de'i don du zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin can gyi dam tshig dang po ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste de'i las so //
translated: For the sake of that accomplishment of uncontaminated existence, the first commitment, which is of the nature of uncontaminated bliss, is without beginning or end, and that is its activity.

original: de'i phyir gsol ba btab pa ni bdag la sgrubs shig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsol ba btab pa ni bdag la sgrubs shig ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the supplication is ‚ÄúEstablish me in that.‚Äù

original: k'i li k'i la'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang bstan to //
analyzed: k'i li k'i la'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang bstan to //
translated: Vajradhara, whose nature is the syllable KƒÄLI KƒÄLI, is indicated.üîΩThe word BHA·πÄ means ‚Äúbind with the fetter of great compassion, which is the non-objectifying [compassion] that is the nature of [your] non-abiding nirvƒÅ·πáa, which reaches the end of the future of cyclic existence.‚Äù

original: bam zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa srid pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i sems can la ltos pa'i rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i bcing bas 'ching bar mdzod cig / padma'i rgyal po skye zhes bya baüîΩdang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bam zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa srid pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i sems can la ltos pa'i rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i bcing bas 'ching bar mdzod cig / padma'i rgyal po skye zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: [It means] ‚Äúbind with the fetter of great compassion, which is the non-objectifying [compassion] that is the nature of [your] non-abiding nirvƒÅ·πáa, which reaches the end of the future of cyclic existence.‚Äù

original: de nyid khyad par du bstan par bya ba'i phyir mchog tu bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du bstan par bya ba'i phyir mchog tu bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares the supreme self, etc.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis chos kyi dbyings @23a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis chos kyi dbyings @23a * //
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu, which has the characteristic of non-objectifying great compassion,

original: ni mchog tu bdag ste de'i sku ni de las byung ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste de 'dzin par byed pas na mchog tu bdag gi sku 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ni mchog tu bdag ste de'i sku ni de las byung ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste de 'dzin par byed pas na mchog tu bdag gi sku 'dzin pa'o //
translated: is the supreme self. His body is the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya that arises from that. Since he holds that, he is the holder of the supreme self‚Äôs body.

original: thams cad rnal 'byor ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos te /
analyzed: thams cad rnal 'byor ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos te /
translated: All yoga is the great Vajradhara.

original: de rnam par rgyal ba ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de rnam par rgyal ba ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: That victory is the victory over the demon of afflictions, etc. by the samƒÅdhi of natural purity.

original: de bsgreng ba ni rdo rje chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan gyis nye bar mtshan pa'i rdo rje dran pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de bsgreng ba ni rdo rje chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan gyis nye bar mtshan pa'i rdo rje dran pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'o //
translated: That is the supreme body-holder, which is the form of Vajrasattva, the nature of the vajra of memory, characterized by the banner of the vajra sea-monster.

original: mchog tu bdag gi sku 'dzin pa yang de yin la rnal 'byor thams cad rnam par bsgrang ba yang de nyid yin pas mchog tu bdag gi sku 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor thams cad rnam par rgyal ba'i bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu bdag gi sku 'dzin pa yang de yin la rnal 'byor thams cad rnam par bsgrang ba yang de nyid yin pas mchog tu bdag gi sku 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor thams cad rnam par rgyal ba'i bsgreng ba'o //
translated: That is the supreme body-holder, and that is the victory banner of all yogas, therefore it is the victory banner of all yogas, the supreme body-holder.

original: de nyid kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i bag chags dang bral bas rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bos rab tu mchog gis dag pa ni rab mchog gis dag pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i bag chags dang bral bas rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bos rab tu mchog gis dag pa ni rab mchog gis dag pa ste /
translated: That is the supreme purity, because it is free from the instinct for the stain of afflictions, and by the nature of the samƒÅdhi of natural purity.

original: des bde ba gang la yod pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: des bde ba gang la yod pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: That is the bliss-endowed, because it is the bliss that exists in that.

original: de ltar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni /
translated: Thus,

original: khyod ni padma'i rgyal po ste //
analyzed: khyod ni padma'i rgyal po ste //
translated: you are the king of lotuses,

original: gyur cig ces bya ba ni sgrub par gyur cig ces bod pa'o //
analyzed: gyur cig ces bya ba ni sgrub par gyur cig ces bod pa'o //
translated: the one who is to be accomplished, is the request to accomplish.

original: padma bzhin du 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dri ma rnams kyis mgos pas mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: padma bzhin du 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dri ma rnams kyis mgos pas mdzes pa ste /
translated: Beautiful means that one is not overcome by the stains of worldly dharmas, like a lotus.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje dran pa ma'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje dran pa ma'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang bstan to //
translated: This teaches that Vajradhara is the nature of Vajra Am·πõta.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bsnyems pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i ngo bo dang sangs rgyas sbrul pa'i mchod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi las dbang du mdzad pas yi ge ho: yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bsnyems pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i ngo bo dang sangs rgyas sbrul pa'i mchod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi las dbang du mdzad pas yi ge ho: yin no //
translated: The syllable HO·∏§ is the essence of the activity of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings through the pride that is the nature of the perfection of diligence and the essence of the worship of the emanation of the buddhas.

original: de nyid khyad par du bstan par bya ba'i phyir rab mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩrab mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du bstan par bya ba'i phyir rab mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rab mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: In order to teach that very point, supreme and so on are stated.üîΩSupreme is excellent.

original: rab mchog las kyang phul du byung bas na mchog gi mchog go //
analyzed: rab mchog las kyang phul du byung bas na mchog gi mchog go //
translated: Since it is more excellent than the excellent, it is the supreme of the supreme.

original: dngos grub kyang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas dngos grub thams cad de //
analyzed: dngos grub kyang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas dngos grub thams cad de //
translated: And it is also all perfections, so it is all perfections.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i sangs rgyas la mchod pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i sangs rgyas la mchod pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The worship of the Buddha who acts for the benefit of sentient beings is of the nature of the perfect emanation body.

original: des mchog kyang yin la dbang phyug kyang yin pas na dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: des mchog kyang yin la dbang phyug kyang yin pas na dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Since he is the best and also the lord, he is the lord of all perfections.üîΩThe nature of the best lord of all perfections is Akashagarbha.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug dam pa'i rang bzhin can nam mkha'i snying po kye bdag @23b la gyur cig ces bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug dam pa'i rang bzhin can nam mkha'i snying po kye bdag @23b la gyur cig ces bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: May he be my Kye! self.

original: nam mkha' ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes te de nyid snying po ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes te de nyid snying po ste /
translated: Space is the wisdom of successful action, which is equal to space by its natural luminosity. That is the essence.

original: skye ba'i gnas gang la yod pa de ni nam mkha'i snying po ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas gang la yod pa de ni nam mkha'i snying po ste /
translated: The one who has that as his abode is Akashagarbha.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo//
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo//
translated: He is Vajradhara, who holds the nature of the emanation body.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma re re nyid du bdag la grub gyur cig ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma re re nyid du bdag la grub gyur cig ba'o //
translated: Always means in every moment.

original: de yang ji ltar zha na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zha na /
translated: And how is that?üîΩMay I be accomplished in the form of the supreme lord of all powers.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug dam pa'i gzugs kyis bdag la grub par gyur cig ces bya ba slob dpon gyis bod pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug dam pa'i gzugs kyis bdag la grub par gyur cig ces bya ba slob dpon gyis bod pa yin te /
translated: This is the master's declaration,

original: 'dis rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang bstan to //
translated: and by this he teaches Vajradhara, who is of the nature of Vajraraga.

original: 'dor bsdus na 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin dza: zhes bya ba dang / k'i li k'i la'i rang bzhin h'um zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje dran pa ma'i rang bzhin bam zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje 'chang rgyas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dor bsdus na 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin dza: zhes bya ba dang / k'i li k'i la'i rang bzhin h'um zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje dran pa ma'i rang bzhin bam zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje 'chang rgyas par bstan pa ste /
translated: In brief, he is of the nature of JAH, who is of the nature of Raga, of the nature of HUM, who is of the nature of Kali Kali, of the nature of BAM, who is of the nature of Vajrasmrti, and of the nature of Vajraraga, who is Vajradhara.

original: mdor bsdus na ho: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na ho: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In brief, he is of the nature of HOH.

original: lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin de nyid 'bab par mdzod cig ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin de nyid 'bab par mdzod cig ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That very nature of the four goddesses, please descend.

original: hu lu hu lu zhes bya ba dang / sgrubs shig ces bya ba thams cad dgug pa'i grub pas bdag la sgrubs shig ces bya'o //
analyzed: hu lu hu lu zhes bya ba dang / sgrubs shig ces bya ba thams cad dgug pa'i grub pas bdag la sgrubs shig ces bya'o //
translated: Hula hula and accomplish are all the accomplishments of summoning, so accomplish for me is said.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dam tshig chen po rnams kyis yang dag dgug ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dam tshig chen po rnams kyis yang dag dgug ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, the great commitments are summoned.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ston pa'i yi ge rnams ni dam tshig chen po rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ston pa'i yi ge rnams ni dam tshig chen po rnams so //
translated: The letters that teach the nature of RƒÅgavajrƒÅ and so forth are the great commitments.

original: dam tshig chen po'i de dag gi phyogs bcu nas 'dren cing yang dag par dgug pa ni bcom ldan 'das kye bdag la grub par gyur cig ces bya ba la slob dpon gyis gsol ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i de dag gi phyogs bcu nas 'dren cing yang dag par dgug pa ni bcom ldan 'das kye bdag la grub par gyur cig ces bya ba la slob dpon gyis gsol ba btab pa yin no //
translated: Summoning those great commitments from the ten directions and summoning them is the master's supplication, BhagavƒÅn, be accomplished for me.

original: bdag rang bzhin ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdag rang bzhin ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of nature does one have?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba la byang chub kyi sems dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba la byang chub kyi sems dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: The mind and mental factors that have the nature of those are all tathƒÅgatas.

original: de rnams kyi dam tshig ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje 'chang ngo //üîΩrab tu dga' ba khyod @24a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dam tshig ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje 'chang ngo // rab tu dga' ba khyod @24a * //
translated: The pledge of those is Vajradhara, who has the nature of the secret of the body of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: ni bdag la zhes bya ba zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i rang bzhin can khyod gang yin pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba 'dis de dang lhan cig tu gyurüîΩpa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ni bdag la zhes bya ba zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i rang bzhin can khyod gang yin pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba 'dis de dang lhan cig tu gyurüîΩpa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú You are my joy‚Äù means that you are Vajrasattva and so forth, who have the nature of the secret of the body, and have arisen from the uncontaminated bliss and mental satisfaction.üîΩ‚Äú You are my very self‚Äù indicates that you are the very self of the yogin who has become one with him.

original: mchog dang po zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la bod pa'o //
analyzed: mchog dang po zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la bod pa'o //
translated: The first supreme is addressed to Bhagavat Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar thams cad dgug pa bstan nas da ni mchod pa chen po bshad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad dgug pa bstan nas da ni mchod pa chen po bshad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught the summoning of all, now, in order to explain the great worship, he says, etc.

original: dpal dam tshig gsum gyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du dngos grub thams cad kyi don du mchod pa chen po ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa phyag rgya bcu gnyis kyis mchod pa ste /
analyzed: dpal dam tshig gsum gyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du dngos grub thams cad kyi don du mchod pa chen po ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa phyag rgya bcu gnyis kyis mchod pa ste /
translated: The great worship for the sake of all powers in the secret mandala of the three commitments is the worship with the twelve seals, such as the passion-vajra woman, etc.

original: de'i cho ga ni rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi phyag rgya'i mchod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i cho ga ni rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi phyag rgya'i mchod pa la bya'o //
translated: The rite of that is the worship with the twelve kinds of seals.

original: rang lha'i rnal 'byor ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dag gis 'dod pa'i lha'i rang bzhin can du bdag nyid sgom pa ni 'dir lta'i rnal 'byor ji bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: rang lha'i rnal 'byor ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dag gis 'dod pa'i lha'i rang bzhin can du bdag nyid sgom pa ni 'dir lta'i rnal 'byor ji bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Just as in the yoga of one's deity means that one should practice just as in the yoga of one's deity, i.e., one should meditate on oneself as having the nature of the desired deity by means of the yoga and subsequent yoga.

original: thams cad kyang yin la mchod pa yang de nyid yin pas na mchod pa thams cad de /
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la mchod pa yang de nyid yin pas na mchod pa thams cad de /
translated: All of them are worship, and that is worship itself, thus it is all worship.

original: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bcu gnyis kyis mchod ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bcu gnyis kyis mchod ba'o //
translated: It is worship with the twelve seals, such as Vajra Weapon.

original: de dag gi mchog gi sku ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag gi mchog gi sku ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcu gnyis so //
translated: The supreme body of those is the twelve great seals, such as Rativajri.

original: de rnams kyis rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la slar yang glu dang rol mo rnam par 'phrul pa ni 'og ma nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyis mchod par bya'o ;
analyzed: de rnams kyis rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la slar yang glu dang rol mo rnam par 'phrul pa ni 'og ma nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyis mchod par bya'o ;
translated: Having worshipped with those, one should worship with the emanations of song and music, which have the characteristics explained below, with one's own nature endowed with the yoga of one's deity.

original: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni skabs su bab pa ste mchod pa'i skabs 'di la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni skabs su bab pa ste mchod pa'i skabs 'di la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word then indicates the proper occasion, meaning this occasion of worship.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub ste /
translated: The supreme attainment of all Ones Gone Thus is the supreme attainment of all Ones Gone Thus.

original: de'i don du mchod pa chen po ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i phyag rgya'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du mchod pa chen po ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i phyag rgya'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The great worship for that purpose is the worship with the seal just explained.

original: de'i mchog ni phyag rgya'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mchog ni phyag rgya'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The supreme of that is the worship with the seal.

original: der mchog tu gsang ba dang / 'da' bar dka' ba dang / mi phyed pa'i glu'i mchod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der mchog tu gsang ba dang / 'da' bar dka' ba dang / mi phyed pa'i glu'i mchod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There, the supreme secret, difficult to transgress, and the worship with the song of the indivisible is the meaning of the words.

original: thams cad kyang yin la rjes su chags pa yang de nyid yin @24b pas na thams cad rjes su chags pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la rjes su chags pa yang de nyid yin @24b pas na thams cad rjes su chags pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa sgom pa'o //
translated: Since all are also the passion of that, it is the meditation on Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de nyid bde bas te rdo rje sems dpa' la mchod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bde ba mngon du gyur pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir des rdo rje sems dpa' nyid la bod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bde bas te rdo rje sems dpa' la mchod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bde ba mngon du gyur pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir des rdo rje sems dpa' nyid la bod pa'o //
translated: That itself is the bliss, because it is the cause of the actualization of the bliss that has the nature of the worship of Vajrasattva, etc. By that, one is worshipped by Vajrasattva himself.

original: thams cad rjes su chags pa'i bde bde gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad rjes su chags pa'i bde bde gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the bliss of the passion of all?

original: dam pa'i thugs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i thugs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the mind of the holy one.

original: thams dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can gyi mchog tu gyur pa'i thugs gang la mnga' ba de ni dam pa'i thugs te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can gyi mchog tu gyur pa'i thugs gang la mnga' ba de ni dam pa'i thugs te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The one who has the supreme mind endowed with the nature of the perfection of wisdom is the one with the holy mind, the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi rdo rje sems dpa' khyod ni bdag la gyur cig ces bya ba 'dis kun mchog so sor rtog pa'i rang bzhin can la slob dpon gyis gsol ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rdo rje sems dpa' khyod ni bdag la gyur cig ces bya ba 'dis kun mchog so sor rtog pa'i rang bzhin can la slob dpon gyis gsol ba btab pa yin no //
translated: You, Vajrasattva, become my self- by this the master requests the one endowed with the nature of the discrimination of the best of all.

original: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba k'i li k'i la'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba k'i li k'i la'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: The one called very joyful is the one endowed with the nature of the Kali Kali.

original: de nyid 'da' bar mi bya ba'i phyir dam tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid 'da' bar mi bya ba'i phyir dam tshig go //
translated: That itself is the pledge because it is not to be transgressed.

original: bde ba chen po bdag la gyur cig ces bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po bdag la gyur cig ces bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The one called great bliss is the one who requests, Become my self.

original: brtan mtho zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i sku bdag la gsol bar mdzod cig pa ste /
analyzed: brtan mtho zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i sku bdag la gsol bar mdzod cig pa ste /
translated: The one called firm high is the one who requests, Bestow on me the body that is indivisible.

original: 'dis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje dran ma bdag la gsol cig pa'o zhes gsol ba btab pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje dran ma bdag la gsol cig pa'o zhes gsol ba btab pa ste /
translated: By this he requests, Bestow on me the vajra mindfulness that is the nature of non-abiding nirvana.

original: brtan pa dang mtho ba la sogs pa la gsol ba mngon par phyogs par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang mtho ba la sogs pa la gsol ba mngon par phyogs par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Strive to attain stability, loftiness, and so on.

original: brtan pa dang mtho ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyis myur du sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas sems can gyi las la rab tu 'dud pa ni mchog tu 'dud par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: brtan pa dang mtho ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyis myur du sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas sems can gyi las la rab tu 'dud pa ni mchog tu 'dud par mdzad pa ste /
translated: By the power of stability, loftiness, and so on, the emanations of the Buddha quickly bow to the karma of sentient beings, that is, they bow down to the supreme.

original: 'dis rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos grub kyi phyir gsol ba btab pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dis rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos grub kyi phyir gsol ba btab pa'o ;
translated: By this, one prays for the power of Vajra-Kamadhatvi, the Lady of the Vajra Desire.

original: / de ltar mchod pa chen po bstan nas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa rnam par 'grel bar bya ba'i phyir de la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / de ltar mchod pa chen po bstan nas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa rnam par 'grel bar bya ba'i phyir de la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught the great worship, in order to explain the self-consecration, he says, etc.

original: mchog tu gsang ba dam pa'i dpal dam tshig gsum ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnams kyis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa ni dngos grub thams cad kyi byin gyis brlab pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba dam pa'i dpal dam tshig gsum ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnams kyis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa ni dngos grub thams cad kyi byin gyis brlab pa ste /
translated: The glorious three vows, which are the supreme secret, are the consecration of the vajra body, speech, and mind of glorious Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgrub pa chen po'i rgyud ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgrub pa chen po'i rgyud ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the great tantra that teaches that?

original: rang lha'i sbyor ba ji bzhin du zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor dang / rjes su rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid dang / rnal 'byor @25a * //
analyzed: rang lha'i sbyor ba ji bzhin du zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor dang / rjes su rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid dang / rnal 'byor @25a * //
translated: As one's own deity yoga, and so on.

original: chen po'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: chen po'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:üîΩOne's own deity yoga is the yoga, the subsequent yoga, and the great yoga.

original: de nyid chos dang las dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs te /üîΩbstan par bya ba gang yin pa de ni phyag rgya kun gyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //üîΩde nyid chen po'i mchog gis ni //
analyzed: de nyid chos dang las dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs te / bstan par bya ba gang yin pa de ni phyag rgya kun gyis byin gyis brlab pa'o // de nyid chen po'i mchog gis ni //
translated: One should bless oneself with the Dharma, karma, and pledge seals, and that which is to be blessed is all seals.üîΩOne should accomplish oneself with the supreme of all great seals, and the moon of the essence means that one's own deity yoga, which is blessed by all seals, is the great seal.

original: rang nyid bsgrubs te snying po zla zhes bya ba la rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du phyag rgya kun gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid /
analyzed: rang nyid bsgrubs te snying po zla zhes bya ba la rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du phyag rgya kun gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid /
translated: One should accomplish oneself with the supreme of all great seals, and the moon of the essence means that one's own deity yoga, which is blessed by all seals, is the great seal.

original: de kho na nyid dang / chos dang / dam tshig gi mtshan nyid can gyi mchog gi de kho na nyid chen pos rab tu bsgrubs pa ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas nas rang gi lha'i snying po h'um la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bzlas pa ni mngon par bsngags par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang / chos dang / dam tshig gi mtshan nyid can gyi mchog gi de kho na nyid chen pos rab tu bsgrubs pa ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas nas rang gi lha'i snying po h'um la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bzlas pa ni mngon par bsngags par bya'o //
translated: Having accomplished the supreme reality with the reality, Dharma, and pledge characteristics, and having completed and brought to culmination the recitation of the essence mantra of one's deity, such as H≈™·πÇ, one should consecrate it.üîΩAnd that is stated:

original: de yang / de nyid kyis ni rdo rje gzung //
analyzed: de yang / de nyid kyis ni rdo rje gzung //
translated: One should hold the vajra with that,

original: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya //
analyzed: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya //
translated: and ring the Dharma-bell.

original: dam tshig gis ni phyag rgya cher //
analyzed: dam tshig gis ni phyag rgya cher //
translated: With the pledge, one should make the great seal,

original: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
translated: and, having blessed it, one should recite the essence mantra.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid dang / chos dang / dam tshig rnams kyis bdag nyid rab tu bsgrubs la dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid dang / chos dang / dam tshig rnams kyis bdag nyid rab tu bsgrubs la dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having accomplished oneself with the realities, Dharma, and pledges, one should make the song offering of the three pledges. In order to demonstrate this rite, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn, the TathƒÅgata, said this to VajrapƒÅ·πái, the great being:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rdzogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe supreme attainment of all tathƒÅgatas is the perfection of the vajra body, speech, and mind of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: de'i don du byin gyis brlab pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i nus pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i don du byin gyis brlab pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i nus pa bskyed de /
translated: For that purpose, the consecration is the generation of the power of the vajra body, speech, and mind of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: de'i mchog gi de kho na nyid ston par byed pa'i mchog gi gsang ba gang yin pa de dam tshig gi rdo rje'i glu'i mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mchog gi de kho na nyid ston par byed pa'i mchog gi gsang ba gang yin pa de dam tshig gi rdo rje'i glu'i mchod pa yin no //
translated: The supreme secret that reveals the suchness of that is the offering of the song of the vajra commitment.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the special quality of that?

original: mchog tu grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúsupreme attainment.‚Äù

original: aom zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mdangs kyi dpal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mdangs kyi dpal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúO·πÉ‚Äù means the splendor of RƒÅgavajrƒÅ and so forth.

original: nam mkha' skye ba mtshan ldan phyir //
analyzed: nam mkha' skye ba mtshan ldan phyir //
translated: Because of the characteristic of being born from space,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' ni rdzas thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' ni rdzas thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin /
translated: Just as space is the nature free from all substances,

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa'i rdzas zhig pas skye bo zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa'i rdzas zhig pas skye bo zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du /
translated: and when a substance such as a wall is destroyed, people designate it as ‚Äúspace,‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje sems dpa' ni yang dag @25b pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral bas sems can rnams kyi rgyud la skye ba'o zhes 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje sems dpa' ni yang dag @25b pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral bas sems can rnams kyi rgyud la skye ba'o zhes 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: in the same way, Vajrasattva, the nature of the vajra of suchness, is designated as ‚Äúarisen in the mindstreams of sentient beings‚Äù due to being free from the stains of incorrect conception.

original: des na nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das yin no //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das yin no //
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn possesses the characteristics of arising space.

original: nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de nyid kyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de nyid kyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: By possessing the characteristics of arising space, he is without beginning and end.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa gzhan dag kyang thog ma dang tha ma med par yongs su brtag pa'i tshul gyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa gzhan dag kyang thog ma dang tha ma med par yongs su brtag pa'i tshul gyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: Other things known in the world are also without beginning and end by the method of thorough investigation, but not ultimately.

original: de'i phyir de rnams las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach its superiority over those, he says, ‚Äúsupreme.‚Äù

original: don dam par thog ma tha ma med pa'i mchog / ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don dam par thog ma tha ma med pa'i mchog / ces bya ba yin no //
translated: It is supreme, without beginning or end in the ultimate sense.

original: de lta bu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sems dpa'i rdo rje che rang bzhin //
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rje che rang bzhin //
translated: The nature of the great being-vajra.

original: zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dpa' ni sems dpa'i rdo rje chen po'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dpa' ni sems dpa'i rdo rje chen po'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The being-vajra, which has the nature of the vajra of thusness, is the nature of the great being-vajra.

original: de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it has the nature of mind and mental factors, which are of one taste with thusness.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag grub mdzod //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag grub mdzod //
translated: Make me accomplished as Vajrasattva.

original: ces bya ba ni sgrub pa pos gsol ba btab po //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sgrub pa pos gsol ba btab po //
translated: The practitioner makes this request.

original: gzhung 'di tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: gzhung 'di tsam gyis ni /
translated: By this much of the text,

original: thog mtha' med pa'i sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa'i sems dpa' ni //
translated: The being without beginning or end

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: Is explained to have the meaning of ‚ÄúVajrasattva.‚Äù

original: da ni dga' ba che zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dga' ba che zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of ‚Äúgreat joy,‚Äù he says the supreme of all, etc.

original: thams cad kyi mchog ni kun mchog ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi mchog ni kun mchog ste /
translated: The supreme of all is the supreme of all;

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos grub kun mchog kyang yin la dngos grub chen po yang de nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos grub kun mchog kyang yin la dngos grub chen po yang de nyid yin pas na /
translated: it is the supreme of all mundane and supramundane, the supreme of all powers, which has the nature of great enlightenment.

original: kun mchog dngos grub chen po'o //
analyzed: kun mchog dngos grub chen po'o //
translated: It is the supreme of all, and it is the great power.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi dbang du ma gyur pa de nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug chen po ste /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi dbang du ma gyur pa de nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug chen po ste /
translated: It is the great lord because it is not under the control of others, due to being free from afflictions together with their traces.

original: sku thams cad bstan pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir gtso bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku thams cad bstan pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir gtso bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the chief because it acts for the welfare of sentient beings by displaying all bodies.

original: de dang rgyu mthun pa'i lha ni lhag pa'i lha ste /
analyzed: de dang rgyu mthun pa'i lha ni lhag pa'i lha ste /
translated: The deity that is concordant with that is the supreme deity.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: the supreme deity, whose nature is the great seal of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i rang bzhin dang po rdo rje ni rdo rje thams cad de /
analyzed: gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i rang bzhin dang po rdo rje ni rdo rje thams cad de /
translated: The first vajra, whose nature is the great reality of the five secrets, is all vajras.

original: de 'dzin pas na @26a * //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na @26a * //
translated: Since he holds that,

original: rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
translated: he is the holder of all vajras.

original: de yang rigs thams cad kyi bdag po'i tshul gyis thams cad las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rigs thams cad kyi bdag po'i tshul gyis thams cad las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
translated: Moreover, he is the victor over all, since he is the lord of all families.

original: 'dir rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags par byas nas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid kyi glus bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags par byas nas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid kyi glus bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the Bhagavat is taught by the song of reality, having figuratively applied the effect to the cause, in the form of the great seal.

original: mi 'gyur mchog tu bdag grub mdzod //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mchog tu bdag grub mdzod //
translated: Make me accomplished in the unchanging supreme!

original: ces bya ba bod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba bod pa'o //
translated: This is the Tibetan.üîΩThat is,

original: de ni / kun du bzang po kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: de ni / kun du bzang po kun bdag nyid //
translated: Samantabhadra, the lord of all,üîΩthe lord of lords, the vajra-conqueror.

original: rdo rje bsnyems pa bdag po bdag / ces bya ba 'di'i don dang dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje bsnyems pa bdag po bdag / ces bya ba 'di'i don dang dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to recall the meaning of this,

original: nyes pa mi mnga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyes pa mi mnga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúfree from faults,‚Äù and so on.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas na skyon med pa ste rang bzhin des brtag pa khyod yin no //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas na skyon med pa ste rang bzhin des brtag pa khyod yin no //
translated: You are the one to be examined by that nature, because you are free from the afflictions together with their traces, and therefore are faultless.

original: 'dis ni kun du bzang po'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun du bzang po'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the meaning of Samantabhadra.

original: tshul gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis 'dul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis 'dul ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of disciplining sentient beings by just that very means by which they are to be disciplined,

original: 'dod chags kun gyi rjes chags te //
analyzed: 'dod chags kun gyi rjes chags te //
translated: he is the one who is passionately attached to all passion.

original: 'dis ni thams cad bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: This has the meaning of ‚Äúall is self,‚Äù and so forth.

original: chags pa chen po dga' ba che //
analyzed: chags pa chen po dga' ba che //
translated: He is the great passion, the great joy,

original: bcom ldan de nyid kyis grub mdzod //
analyzed: bcom ldan de nyid kyis grub mdzod //
translated: the Bhagavat, who is accomplished by that very reality.

original: ces bya bas bod ba dang bcas pa'i dngos grub kyi phyir gsol ba btab pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya bas bod ba dang bcas pa'i dngos grub kyi phyir gsol ba btab pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the request for the accomplishment of the boon.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid kyi glu'i mchod pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid kyi glu'i mchod pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the offering of the song of reality,

original: da ni chos kyi glu'i mchod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi glu'i mchod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now, in order to teach the offering of the song of Dharma, he says extremely, and so on.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu dag pa'o //
translated: It is extremely pure because it is free from the stain of the conceptualization of subject and object until the end of time.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad las mchog tu gyur pas na kun mchog go //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad las mchog tu gyur pas na kun mchog go //
translated: It is the best of all, because it is superior to the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: gdod nas grol ba de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: gdod nas grol ba de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathagata is primordially liberated.

original: zhes bya ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis rtag tu 'ching ba thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gdod nas grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis rtag tu 'ching ba thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gdod nas grol ba'o //
translated: The Tathagata is primordially liberated because he is always free from all bondage by the nature of the dharmadhatu which is without beginning or end.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang thabs kyi rang bzhin du dngos po rnams mkhyen pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang thabs kyi rang bzhin du dngos po rnams mkhyen pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Tathagata because he knows things as they are, by the nature of the dharmadhatu and by the nature of means.

original: gzhan yang gzhan dag la de bzhin du gsungs pa rab tu ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dag la de bzhin du gsungs pa rab tu ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Tathagata because he teaches others in that way.

original: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la kun nas @26b bzang po'i dga' ba gang las byung ba de ni kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la kun nas @26b bzang po'i dga' ba gang las byung ba de ni kun du bzang po'o //
translated: The one called Samantabhadra is the one from whom arises the universal good pleasure of sentient beings, that is, Samantabhadra.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du zhugs pas na kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du zhugs pas na kun bdag nyid do //
translated: The one who is the nature of all things, both animate and inanimate, is the universal self.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The one who is the nature of enlightenment is the bodhisattva.

original: rab tu bsgrubs zhes bya bas gsol ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrubs zhes bya bas gsol ba btab pa yin no //
translated: The one who is well-accomplished is the one who has made the request.

original: de ltar chos kyi glu'i mchod pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi glu'i mchod pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the offering of the song of Dharma,

original: da ni dam tshig gi glu'i mchod pa bstan par bya ba ni kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩkun gyi mchog kyang de yin la dngos grub chen po yang de nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: da ni dam tshig gi glu'i mchod pa bstan par bya ba ni kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / kun gyi mchog kyang de yin la dngos grub chen po yang de nyid yin pas na /
translated: now, in order to teach the offering of the song of commitment, he says the supreme of all, etc.üîΩThat is the supreme of all and also the great attainment,

original: kun mchog dngos grub chen po ste //
analyzed: kun mchog dngos grub chen po ste //
translated: thus it is the supreme of all, the great attainment.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of Great Vajradhara, who is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de nyid dbang phyug chen po ste de yod pas phyag rgya'i mchog gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de nyid dbang phyug chen po ste de yod pas phyag rgya'i mchog gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That is the great lord, and because of his existence, the supreme seal is

original: kun mchog dngos grub chen po yi //
analyzed: kun mchog dngos grub chen po yi //
translated: the great power of the supreme of all.

original: dbang phyug chen po'i phyag rgya'i mchog ste dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i phyag rgya'i mchog ste dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The supreme seal of the great lord is the great seal of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid kyis grub par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis grub par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May I be accomplished by that very [Vajrasattva].

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rdo rje cher bstod pa zhes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i dngos po'i rdo rje cher bstod pa ni rdo rje cher bstod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje cher bstod pa zhes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i dngos po'i rdo rje cher bstod pa ni rdo rje cher bstod pa'o //
translated: The great praise of the vajra is the great praise of the vajra of the entity explained as it is.

original: lag pa g-yas pa'i sor mo dbus ma'i kha tv'am ga rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul 'dzin pa ni rdo rje cher bstod pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i sor mo dbus ma'i kha tv'am ga rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul 'dzin pa ni rdo rje cher bstod pa ste /
translated: Holding the middle finger of the right hand in the shape of a katvanga at one's heart in the manner of praise is the great praise of the vajra.

original: rdo rje cher bstod pa des sgrubs shig pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyis rdo rje bsnyems pa'i bdag po kye bdag la sgrubs shig ces bya ba la bod pa dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das la sgrub pa pos gsol baüîΩbtab pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje cher bstod pa des sgrubs shig pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyis rdo rje bsnyems pa'i bdag po kye bdag la sgrubs shig ces bya ba la bod pa dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das la sgrub pa pos gsol ba btab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the practitioner supplicates the BhagavƒÅn.

original: de ltar dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the praise with the song of the three commitments,

original: da ni de nyid kyi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de nyid kyi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the benefits of just that,

original: dpal mchog dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares, the glorious supreme first, and so on.

original: dpal mchog dang po ni ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po ni ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The glorious supreme first is the BhagavƒÅn Vajrasattva, just as he was explained.

original: de'i glu ni /
analyzed: de'i glu ni /
translated: His song is

original: aom nam mkha' skye med mtshan ldan phyir //
analyzed: aom nam mkha' skye med mtshan ldan phyir //
translated: the song beginning, O·πÉ, because of the characteristic of space, non-arisen,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i glu sgrub pa pos bcom ldan 'das kyi yang dag par gyur pa'i yon tan brjod cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i glu sgrub pa pos bcom ldan 'das kyi yang dag par gyur pa'i yon tan brjod cing /
translated: and so on. The practitioner recites the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs perfect qualities.

original: don dam par de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig gi don la lhag par mos pas glu blangs na de ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya @27a * //
analyzed: don dam par de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig gi don la lhag par mos pas glu blangs na de ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya @27a * //
translated: If one sings a song with intense devotion to the meaning of reality, the Dharma, and the commitments, how will that be?üîΩIn order to explain that,

original: ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said,

original: de ni dngos grub kun mchog 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni dngos grub kun mchog 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äúthat is the supreme of all powers.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po'o //üîΩni zhes bya ba ni sgra nges par gzung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po'o // ni zhes bya ba ni sgra nges par gzung ba la bya ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the adept.üîΩ‚Äú

original: de nyid kho nar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kho nar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Only‚Äù is to be understood as a definitive particle.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos grub kun gyi mchog ste /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos grub kun gyi mchog ste /
translated: That alone is the supreme of all powers, which is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de'i dbang phyug chen po'i sku thams cad ston par byed pas sems can gyi don to //
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug chen po'i sku thams cad ston par byed pas sems can gyi don to //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is the display of the body of the Great Lord, the supreme of all powers.üîΩEndowed with that Great Lord, one becomes the Great Lord himself.

original: dbang phyug chen po de dang ldan zhing dbang phyug chen po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so//
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po de dang ldan zhing dbang phyug chen po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so//
translated: Thus it is said by the Blessed One, Great Vajradhara.

original: mchog kyang yin la de kho na nyid kyang de nyid yin pas na mchog gi de nyid de /
analyzed: mchog kyang yin la de kho na nyid kyang de nyid yin pas na mchog gi de nyid de /
translated: Since it is supreme and also reality, it is the supreme reality.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams so //
translated: It is the vajras of the body, speech, and mind of Great Vajradhara.

original: de nyid gsang ba'i mchog ni 'jig rten thams cad dang thun mong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gsang ba'i mchog ni 'jig rten thams cad dang thun mong ba ma yin no //
translated: The supreme secret of that is not common to all worlds.

original: de'i glu chen po ni dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i glu chen po ni dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The great song of that is the song-offering of the three pledges.

original: mchog tu grub pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: mchog tu grub pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: Supreme attainment is Vajrasattva.

original: de ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di yang mchog tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di yang mchog tu grub pa'o //
translated: Since it causes the manifestation of that, this is also supreme attainment.

original: mchog tu grub pa yang mngon du byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog gi glu 'di yang mchog tu grub pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu grub pa yang mngon du byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog gi glu 'di yang mchog tu grub pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is also the cause of the manifestation of supreme attainment, this supreme song is also called supreme attainment.

original: dngos grub cho ga 'di yis ni /
analyzed: dngos grub cho ga 'di yis ni /
translated: By this rite of attainment

original: zhes bya ba la dngos grub kyi don gyi cho ga ni dngos grub kyi cho ga ste glu'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dngos grub kyi don gyi cho ga ni dngos grub kyi cho ga ste glu'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The rite of the meaning of attainment is the rite of attainment, which is the song-offering.

original: mchog gi dngos grub kyi cho ga 'dis rdo rje sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su rnal 'byor rang gi mtshan nyid can ni dngos grub chen po kun gyi mchog ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub ste /
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub kyi cho ga 'dis rdo rje sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su rnal 'byor rang gi mtshan nyid can ni dngos grub chen po kun gyi mchog ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub ste /
translated: By this rite of supreme attainment, Vajrasattva, who is the true yoga of oneself, is the supreme of all great attainments, the attainment of Vajrasattva.

original: des dbang phyug chen po ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas khams gsum thams cad du gzugs thams cad ston pas sems can byed pa'o //
analyzed: des dbang phyug chen po ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas khams gsum thams cad du gzugs thams cad ston pas sems can byed pa'o //
translated: By that, he is the great lord, who is the creator of beings, because he is free from the afflictions together with their traces, and because he displays all forms in all three realms.

original: yul der rdo rje sems dpa' dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i sgrub pa pos bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul der rdo rje sems dpa' dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i sgrub pa pos bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: In that place, he is to be accomplished by the adept who is truly united with Vajrasattva.

original: de bzhin du dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa 'dis /
analyzed: de bzhin du dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa 'dis /
translated: Similarly, by this worship with the song of the three commitments,

original: kun nas 'od zer ston sogs dang // zhes bya ba la cho 'phrul brgya rtsa brgyad kyi rnam pa can dang / so sor ston pa'i rmad du byung ba rnams ni ngo mtshar bar gyur pa rnams sgrub pa po'i rdo rje slob dpon gyi rang gi lha dpal rdo rje @27b sems dpa' las mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas 'od zer ston sogs dang // zhes bya ba la cho 'phrul brgya rtsa brgyad kyi rnam pa can dang / so sor ston pa'i rmad du byung ba rnams ni ngo mtshar bar gyur pa rnams sgrub pa po'i rdo rje slob dpon gyi rang gi lha dpal rdo rje @27b sems dpa' las mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: means that the practitioner, the vajra master, will see the wonders, the manifestations of the one hundred and eight miracles, and the marvelous displays, from his or her deity, glorious Vajrasattva.

original: rtog pa kun zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rtog pa sna tshogs chen po'o //
analyzed: rtog pa kun zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rtog pa sna tshogs chen po'o //
translated: All the concepts means the various great secret ma·πá·∏çala concepts.

original: dngos grub ni gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: dngos grub ni gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i dngos grub bo //
translated: Accomplishment is the accomplishment of the great reality of the five secrets.

original: de'i dbang phyug ni ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug ni ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa ste /
translated: The lord of that is as it is explained.

original: de las byung ba'i bde ba ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i bde ba ni /
translated: The bliss that arises from that

original: rtog pa kun gyi sna tshogs che //
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyi sna tshogs che //
translated: is the great variety of all concepts.

original: dngos grub dbang phyug bde ba rnams //
analyzed: dngos grub dbang phyug bde ba rnams //
translated: The lord of accomplishment and blissüîΩis the lord of the five secrets.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung bas te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung bas te /
translated: The word ni is a definitive marker.

original: dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa nyid kyis rtog pa thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i dngos grub kyi bde ba rnams dpal rdo rje sems dpas legs par byin gyis brlabs pas rdo rje slob dpon gyis rtag tu 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa nyid kyis rtog pa thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i dngos grub kyi bde ba rnams dpal rdo rje sems dpas legs par byin gyis brlabs pas rdo rje slob dpon gyis rtag tu 'thob pa yin no //
translated: By the very offering of the song of the three sacred commitments, all the various powers of bliss are well blessed by glorious Vajrasattva, and are always obtained by the vajra master.

original: de ltar bdag la byin gyis brlab pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag la byin gyis brlab pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the self-consecration,

original: da ni rnal 'byor chen po sgrub pa'i rang bzhin can sgrub pa chen po'i rgyud bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor chen po sgrub pa'i rang bzhin can sgrub pa chen po'i rgyud bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the great yoga, the nature of which is the great accomplishment, the tantra of the great accomplishment,

original: de la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äútherein, just as,‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad kyang yin la bdag la byin gyis brlab pa yang de nyid yin pas na thams cad bdag la byin gyis brlab pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la bdag la byin gyis brlab pa yang de nyid yin pas na thams cad bdag la byin gyis brlab pa ste /

original: rang gi rigs kyi lha thams cad sgrub pa po'i lus la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi lha thams cad sgrub pa po'i lus la dgod pa'o //
translated: It is the arrangement of all the deities of one‚Äôs own buddha family in the body of the practitioner.

original: de'i don du lha rnams kyi sgrub pa chen po ni rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis rang la rag las par bya ba de ni thams cad bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i lha'i sgrub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i don du lha rnams kyi sgrub pa chen po ni rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis rang la rag las par bya ba de ni thams cad bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i lha'i sgrub pa chen po'o //
translated: For that purpose, the great practice of the deities is to be dependent on oneself by means of one's pledge seal. That is the great practice of all the deities of the consecration of oneself.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the tantra that teaches that?

original: rang lha'i rnal 'byor ji bzhin du //
analyzed: rang lha'i rnal 'byor ji bzhin du //
translated: As for one's own deity yoga,

original: zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyi rang gi lha ni 'dod pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyi rang gi lha ni 'dod pa'i lha'o //

original: rdo rje thal mo dang rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas snying gar dral bar bya'o //üîΩde nas rdo rje dbab pa bskyed nas rang gi snying gar rdo rje dbab pa'i phyag rgyas dgrol bar byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo dang rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas snying gar dral bar bya'o // de nas rdo rje dbab pa bskyed nas rang gi snying gar rdo rje dbab pa'i phyag rgyas dgrol bar byas la /
translated: Having formed the vajra-palms and vajra-binding, one should open them at the heart.üîΩThen, having generated the vajra-descent, one should open it at one's heart with the seal of the vajra-descent.

original: dam tshig gi rdo rje khu tshur bcings te /
analyzed: dam tshig gi rdo rje khu tshur bcings te /
translated: Then, having formed the pledge vajra fist,

original: phyag rgya thams cad gdeg par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad gdeg par bya'o //

original: de nas sdig pa dral ba'i phyag rgyas sdig pa rnams dral bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sdig pa dral ba'i phyag rgyas sdig pa rnams dral bar bya'o //

original: de nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje la yi ge h'um yid kyis bris la /
analyzed: de nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje la yi ge h'um yid kyis bris la /
translated: Then, the yogin of glorious Vajrasattva should mentally write the syllable h≈´·πÉ on the vajra located in his heart.

original: de nyid yid kyis brjod cing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dang nam mkha' deng mnyam par bsgom par bya'o //üîΩde @28a * //
analyzed: de nyid yid kyis brjod cing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dang nam mkha' deng mnyam par bsgom par bya'o // de @28a * //

original: nas nam mkha'i phyogs su rang gi sems yi ge h'um gi rnam par bsams la dbyangs bcu drug dang bcas pa'i yi ge h'um gis rang gi sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //

translated: Then, in the direction of space, he should visualize his mind in the form of the syllable h≈´·πÉ, and with the syllable h≈´·πÉ together with the sixteen vowels, he should imagine his mind in the nature of a moon disc.

original: de'i steng du ka la sogs pa'i yi ge dang bcas pa'i yi ge h'um las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa de nyid yi ge h'um dang bcas pa'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du ka la sogs pa'i yi ge dang bcas pa'i yi ge h'um las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa de nyid yi ge h'um dang bcas pa'i rdo rje ste /

original: rdo rje'i dbus su yi ge h'um yid kyis bri ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbus su yi ge h'um yid kyis bri ste /
translated: In the center of the vajra, he should mentally write the syllable h≈´·πÉ.

original: gsang ba lnga'i de kho na chen po dang po'i rdo rje zhes bya ba bsgom zhing /
analyzed: gsang ba lnga'i de kho na chen po dang po'i rdo rje zhes bya ba bsgom zhing /

original: rdo rje las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams spros te /
analyzed: rdo rje las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams spros te /
translated: Vajra, having emanated secret ma·πá·∏çalas equal to the particles of all world realms,

analyzed: de dag gis sems can gyi khams thams cad gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rtogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid du byas la de rnams rdo rje la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: having made all the realms of sentient beings the nature of Great Vajradhara through realizing the secret ma·πá·∏çala, one should cause them to enter the vajra.

original: de nas sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa'i sbyor bas bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa'i sbyor bas bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar bsgoms la /
translated: Then, through the yoga of the consecration of the hero, having meditated on oneself as Vajrasattva,

analyzed: ma h'a sa ma ya satva aa ham zhes bzla bar bya'o // de nas dang po'i rdo rje bcings la slar yang sa ma ya aa ham zhes bya ba bzla bar bya'o //
translated: one should recite ‚ÄúmahƒÅsattva-satva-aham.‚ÄùüîΩThen, having bound the original vajra, one should recite ‚Äúsamaya-aham.‚Äù

original: de nas slar dang po'i rdo rjes snying ga dang / smin mtshams dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi po rnams su sa ma ya satva aa dhi tishtha sva mam zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slar dang po'i rdo rjes snying ga dang / smin mtshams dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi po rnams su sa ma ya satva aa dhi tishtha sva mam zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Then, again, with the original vajra, one should consecrate the heart, the brow, the throat, and the head with ‚Äúsamaya-satva-adhisthƒÅna-svam.‚Äù

original: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should bind the great seal.

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin yin no //
translated: Then, one should perform the yoga of one‚Äôs deity, just as in the yoga of Vajrasattva.

analyzed: gzhan la ni rang gi cho gas rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya ste /
translated: For others, one should bind the great seal of one‚Äôs deity, according to one‚Äôs own rite.

original: 'dis rang gi lha'i sku'i gsang bsgom pa ji lta ba bzhin du sku mdog dang / dbyibs dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: lha yang yin la kun yang de nyid yin pas na lha kun te rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi sku ni sku'i gsang ba rnams so //

analyzed: rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji bzhin pa dang / lha kun gyi bdag nyid kyi sku rnams ni rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji bzhin pa'i lha kun gyi bdag nyid kyi sku rnams te /
translated: The yoga of one‚Äôs deity just as it is, and the bodies of all deities that are the nature of all deities, are the bodies of all deities that are the nature of the yoga of one‚Äôs deity just as it is.

original: de dag gis rang gi lha'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor ba de rang gi lha'i @28b dkyil 'khor du bsgrub par bya ba yin te gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis rang gi lha'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor ba de rang gi lha'i @28b dkyil 'khor du bsgrub par bya ba yin te gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are to be accomplished in the mandala of one's deity, not in another's.

original: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor tsam byas la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor bas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la zhugs te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor tsam byas la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor bas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la zhugs te /

original: yi ge h'um gis dang po'i rdo rje bcings nas /
analyzed: yi ge h'um gis dang po'i rdo rje bcings nas /
translated: Having bound the first vajra with the syllable h≈´·πÉ,

analyzed: aa nu ra ga ya mi h'um zhes bya ba brjod cings la rab tu bzhag par byas nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor snying gar rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: one should utter anurƒÅgƒÅya h≈´·πÉ, and having been placed in the supreme state, one should accomplish the secret mandala of glorious Vajrasattva in one's heart.

original: de nas 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings nas der zhugs la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang ba'i bar du rang gi cho ga rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings nas der zhugs la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang ba'i bar du rang gi cho ga rdzogs par bya ste /

translated: In the great places of great yoga taught in the great ma·πá·∏çala of Vajrasattva explained previously, one should sing the song of the secret hook, such as ‚Äú≈örƒ´ Heruka,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi lus la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bcug la dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bcug la dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having inserted Vajrasattva and so on into one‚Äôs body, one should accomplish them with the pledge seals.

analyzed: de nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis rgyas btab la /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rang gi lus dang rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku la snga ma bzhin du bcug ste dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: one should insert all the tathƒÅgatas into one‚Äôs body and the form of Vajrasattva and so on, as before, and accomplish them with the pledge seals.

analyzed: de nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis rgyas btab la /
translated: Then, having sealed them with the Dharma, action, and great seals,

original: dang po'i rdo rje de bzhin du bdag la byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje de bzhin du bdag la byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: one should consecrate oneself as the original vajra.

original: brtan par byed pa'i snying pos brtan par byas la dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya rnams kyis dbang bskur te rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blangs la /
analyzed: brtan par byed pa'i snying pos brtan par byas la dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya rnams kyis dbang bskur te rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blangs la /
translated: the lord, the name initiation, and take up the spiritual practice of the vajra of spiritual powers.

analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya bcu gnyis kyis bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Having made a perfect offering to oneself with the twelve offering mudras, such as the passion vajra,

original: sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje ma'i phyag bzhis phyag btsal bar byas nas de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig rnams la yi ge h'um lan gsum brjod de /

translated: one should pay homage with the four mudras of the goddess Lalitavajra and offer the three vajra offerings of reality, phenomena, and commitment, uttering the syllable h≈´·πÉ three times.

analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi mchod pa byas la rdo rje'i bdag nyid dang / rang bzhin dag pa dang / thams cad mnyam pa'i bdag nyid rnam par @29a * //
translated: Having made the offering of the three commitments, one should contemplate the nature of the vajra, the purity of nature, and the nature of the equality of all.

analyzed: bsgoms la / ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje la yi ge h'um yid kyis bris nas rab tu dga' ba'i ngag gis brjod cing bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: and having written the syllable h≈´·πÉ with the mind on the vajra located in one‚Äôs heart, one should meditate, uttering it with a voice of great joy.

original: de dag thams cad dgug pa dang / mchod pa chen po dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / sgrub pa chen po rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad dgug pa dang / mchod pa chen po dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / sgrub pa chen po rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having taught all of those, the summoning, the great worship, the consecration of oneself, and the great practice,
